content.description: The crux is a thin section about halfway, and the rock is good.
content.location: This route is a left-curving crack on the right side of the face. Descend by walking off the back.

content.description:
A fun route when combined with others on the wall.

On the far left side of the wall is a left leaning crack that leads into a small left facing book. The crux is exiting the book to jugs.
content.location: Far left side of wall up a gully.

climbs.name: Overlooked
climbs.fa: Bob Gaines and Brian Prentice, April 2001

content.description:
Start just left of Worthwhile Pile and climb up and left following thin seams up to a bolt, then move left (crux) to a crack that leads to the top.

This is probably the best route on Worthwhile Pile.
content.protection: To 4 inches, bring many 1/2 inch to 1 inch CDs for the seams. Two #2 and one #3 or #4 camalot work nicely for the anchor if you want to rig a TR.

climbs.name: Worthless Bile
climbs.fa: Tucker Tech, Alan Bartlett & Laurel Colella, March 2000

content.description:
A fun route when combined with others on the wall.

A little funky looking when staring up from the bottom as far as protection goes, but if solid at the grade should be no problem. It had me thinking though.
content.protection: standard rack with a sling for a flake.
content.location:
The next crack right of

Ernie Pyle

.

content.description: The next crack right of Worthless Bile. Follow up two triangle pods up to grove with cracks topping out just left of Holden On.
Easy moves up to a ramp lead to the crux. Protected by a bolt, thin crimps and seams bring you to a welcomed flake to the top. Move fast or get flamed!
content.location: Aprox 10 - 15 feet right of Not Worth Your Pile (5.4) beside the detached pillar.

climbs.name: Holden Hands
climbs.fa: Todd Swain, Mark Holden & Karl Pearson, November 1989

content.description: This route needs to be climbed more often so it will clean up. Loose rock at the bottom, but clean rock at the top with the crux overcoming a bulge halfway up. Although some feel it goes at 5.8, I think it is closer to 5.5.
content.location: On the right side of the face, just right of a yucca. Off the ground go up then left on a ramp to the bulge, pull the bulge, then reach the crack.

content.description:
A fun route when combined with others on the wall.

Go up a handcrack and then go up and right to another crack.
content.location:
6 feet to the right of

Pile it Higher and Deeper

is this little gem.
